questions.question: Why are you considering our company's product?

options.value: Just exploring, no urgent need, nice to have
My manager instructed me to explore your solution as an option to fix our department problem
The executive team noticed that we are having this problem on multiple department levels
Our CXO made your solution a potential fix to our problems because it affects the entire company

questions.commentPlaceholder: Client's company is losing a lot of time and money because of their problem and the entire executive leadership team holds this solution in high priority

questions.question: how much money and time are you losing/spending per month?

options.value: less than $500
more than $2000

questions.commentPlaceholder: Client is losing $12,000 and spending combined 1000 hours of engineering time per month

questions.question: If you continue to have this problem, what would happen?

options.value: Your solution is nice to have, we won't see ramifications until 3+ years out
Your solution is needed, however, its not an, urgent high priority, we won't see ramifications 2+ years out
Your solution is an urgent need right now, without your solution, negative ramifications will happen in < 1 year

questions.commentPlaceholder: Client said that our solution is an immediate urgent need that will solve their immediate problems now

questions.question: What need does our solution satisfy for your business?

options.value: Your solution is nice to have because it does not directly impact our bottom line business product
Your solution aligns with minior dependencies of our core business product, however, its not a direct solution
Your solution is fundamental to our business's core product and without it, we will lose revenue and profit

questions.commentPlaceholder: Client said without our solution, their core product will collapse, their customers will churn, and it will negatively impact their revenue

questions.question: When do you want this change to happen?

options.value: This change is a nice to have, an individual contributor wants this change, but not that important or urgent to managers or executives, 1+ year timeline
This change is a priority from managers, but not that important or urgent to executives, 6+ months timeline
This change is a priority from multiple executives, <6 months timeline

questions.commentPlaceholder: The client's executive leadership is onboard in implementing our solution and making a change

questions.question: What concerns does the client have?

options.value: Big: deal breaker, solution does not fit their needs
Medium: this needs to be addressed before purchase
Small: requested changes or features nice to have, but not an obstacle for deal to close

questions.commentPlaceholder: The client said that this objection is a deal breaker. X is a big deal

questions.question: When is your next meeting and with who?

options.value: Individual Contributor
Manager
Executive
CXO

questions.commentPlaceholder: Meeting with manager on 04/25/2019 at 14:00 PST for a technical demo

questions.question: What company goals are you trying to achieve by purchasing this solution?

options.value: Team Goals: our solution only impacts the goals of a team
Department Goals: our solution affects multiple department's team's goals
Company Goals: our solution impacts their entire company goals

questions.commentPlaceholder: Client said that they are considering our solution because it aligns with top company goals

questions.question: Who is involved in making the buying decision?

options.value: Influencers, they directly benefit from the solution, but not involved in buying decision
Champions, they are manager level, have some influence in buying decision, but not main buying decision maker
Decision Maker, they are executive level, they make the purchase decision

questions.commentPlaceholder: Client said that the VP of Engineering needs to agree to purchase and VP Finance provides the budget

questions.question: Does this company have minimum $15,000 budget for our normal tier product?

options.value: Yes. No discount request. Convinced of value
Maybe. Negotiating discount. Not convinced of value... Yet
No. Solution price is outside their budget. ROI does not justify cost

questions.commentPlaceholder: Client has enough budget for our solutions retail, asking price

questions.question: What are your buying criterias?

options.value: Business Need Requirements
Technical Requirements
RFP (Request For Proposal) Requirement

questions.commentPlaceholder: Client says that as long as our solution solves their business needs

questions.question: how long is the decision making process and what are the steps?

options.value: Less than 5 steps
Between than 5-10 steps
More than 10 steps

questions.commentPlaceholder: Clients says that the decision making process only involves 2 stakeholders from 2 departments

questions.question: What areas are these challenges affecting your business?

options.value: Costing company a lot of time
Costing a lot of employee turnover
Costing a lot money
